title: Global plastic pollution: How are we doing and where are we going ...
body: As we enter the post-pandemic era, the tsunami of 1.56 billion masks, thousands of tons of food packaging waste, and personnel protective equipment made from plastics are triggering new waves of plastic pollution. Reducing, reusing, and recycling remain the rule of thumb for plastic waste, despite the growing global plastic pollution crisis.
readable_content: -User (2023-12-08): The text talks about the global plastic pollution issue and highlights scientific interventions aiming to address the problem. The article discusses the increase in single-use plastics due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the properties and history of plastics, the scale of plastic production and waste, the impact of plastic pollution on the environment, and the innovations being studied to tackle plastic pollution, such as plastic-degrading enzymes, novel infinitely recyclable plastics, and biodegradable bioplastics.
summary: The discussion about addressing plastic pollution through scientific interventions is informative and necessary. It highlights the urgency of the issue and the need for innovative solutions. This approach aligns with the complex nature of the problem and the importance of considering multiple angles to find effective solutions. Sentiment: 0.8
